intro: Aciotis ferreirana, commonly known as the Brazilian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular florets that attract pollinators. Aciotis ferreirana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
